comments.body: What error are we expecting here? This test feels like it would be hard to debug if it breaks in the future. Either a check on the message, and/or a comment saying _why_ we expect this to raise please.
A test that `worker_config.git_sync_ssh_known_hosts_volume_name` is set to something would be good - we are using it in a later test, but we are never checking that this is set to anything directly

`git_sync_ssh_known_hosts_volume_name` is a property set in the Class at initialization, (it does not get it's value from config but rather a hardcoded value)

I can add the following test that checks that those hardcoded values are set but I'm not sure of the value

```python
    def test_worker_config_properties(self):
        worker_config = WorkerConfiguration(self.kube_config)

        self.assertTrue(worker_config.dags_volume_name)
        self.assertTrue(worker_config.logs_volume_name)
        self.assertTrue(worker_config.git_sync_ssh_secret_volume_name)
        self.assertTrue(worker_config.git_ssh_key_secret_key)
        self.assertTrue(worker_config.git_sync_ssh_known_hosts_volume_name)
        self.assertTrue(worker_config.git_ssh_known_hosts_configmap_key)
```
Oh yes, I hadn't twigged that. This is fine then, (though perhaps changing it `worker_config.GIT_SYNC_SSH_KNOWN_HOSTS_VOLUME_NAME` etc. That's a bit ... shouty ... though. Probably leave it as is.)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +409,413 @@        self.kube_config.dags_in_image = None

        worker_config = WorkerConfiguration(self.kube_config)

        init_containers = worker_config._get_init_containers()
